     14 // Mapping from known file extensions to filetype hinting.
     15 var filenameToLangMap map[string]string = map[string]string{
     16 	"BUILD":     "python",
     17 	"WORKSPACE": "python",
     18 }
     19 var extToLangMap map[string]string = map[string]string{
     20 	".AppleScript": "applescript",
     21 	".bzl":         "python",
     22 	".c":           "c",
     23 	".coffee":      "coffeescript",
     24 	".cpp":         "cpp",
     25 	".css":         "css",
     26 	".go":          "go",
     27 	".h":           "cpp",
     28 	".hs":          "haskell",
     29 	".html":        "markup",
     30 	".java":        "java",
     31 	".js":          "javascript",
     32 	".json":        "json",
     33 	".jsx":         "jsx",
     34 	".m":           "objectivec",
     35 	".markdown":    "markdown",
     36 	".md":          "markdown",
     37 	".nix":         "nix",
     38 	".php":         "php",
     39 	".pl":          "perl",
     40 	".proto":       "go",
     41 	".py":          "python",
     42 	".pyst":        "python",
     43 	".rb":          "ruby",
     44 	".rs":          "rust",
     45 	".scala":       "scala",
     46 	".scpt":        "applescript",
     47 	".scss":        "scss",
     48 	".sh":          "bash",
     49 	".sql":         "sql",
     50 	".swift":       "swift",
     51 	".tsx":         "tsx",
     52 	".xml":         "markup",
     53 	".yaml":        "yaml",
     54 	".yml":         "yaml",
     55 }
     56 
     57 type breadCrumbEntry struct {
     58 	Name string
     59 	Path string
     60 }
     61 
     62 type directoryListEntry struct {
     63 	Name          string
     64 	Path          string
     65 	IsDir         bool
     66 	SymlinkTarget string
     67 }
     68 
     69 type fileViewerContext struct {
     70 	PathSegments   []breadCrumbEntry
     71 	Repo           config.RepoConfig
     72 	Commit         string
     73 	DirContent     *directoryContent
     74 	FileContent    *sourceFileContent
     75 	ExternalDomain string
     76 	Permalink      string
     77 	Headlink       string
     78 }
     79 
     80 type sourceFileContent struct {
     81 	Content   string
     82 	LineCount int
     83 	Language  string
     84 }
     85 
     86 type directoryContent struct {
     87 	Entries []directoryListEntry
     88 }
     89 
     90 type DirListingSort []directoryListEntry
     91 
     92 func (s DirListingSort) Len() int {
     93 	return len(s)
     94 }
     95 
     96 func (s DirListingSort) Swap(i, j int) {
     97 	s[i], s[j] = s[j], s[i]
     98 }
     99 
    100 func (s DirListingSort) Less(i, j int) bool {
    101 	if s[i].IsDir != s[j].IsDir {
    102 		return s[i].IsDir
    103 	}
    104 	return s[i].Name < s[j].Name
    105 }
    106 
    107 func gitCommitHash(ref string, repoPath string) (string, error) {
    108 	out, err := exec.Command(
    109 		"git", "-C", repoPath, "rev-parse", ref,
    110 	).Output()
    111 	if err != nil {
    112 		return "", err
    113 	}
    114 	return string(out), nil
    115 }
    116 
    117 func gitObjectType(obj string, repoPath string) (string, error) {
    118 	out, err := exec.Command("git", "-C", repoPath, "cat-file", "-t", obj).Output()
    119 	if err != nil {
    120 		return "", err
    121 	}
    122 	return strings.TrimSpace(string(out)), nil
    123 }
    124 
    125 func gitCatBlob(obj string, repoPath string) (string, error) {
    126 	out, err := exec.Command("git", "-C", repoPath, "cat-file", "blob", obj).Output()
    127 	if err != nil {
    128 		return "", err
    129 	}
    130 	return string(out), nil
    131 }
    132 
    133 type gitTreeEntry struct {
    134 	Mode       string
    135 	ObjectType string
    136 	ObjectId   string
    137 	ObjectName string
    138 }
    139 
    140 func gitParseTreeEntry(line string) gitTreeEntry {
    141 	dataAndPath := strings.SplitN(line, "\t", 2)
    142 	dataFields := strings.Split(dataAndPath[0], " ")
    143 	return gitTreeEntry{
    144 		Mode:       dataFields[0],
    145 		ObjectType: dataFields[1],
    146 		ObjectId:   dataFields[2],
    147 		ObjectName: dataAndPath[1],
    148 	}
    149 }
    150 
    151 func gitListDir(obj string, repoPath string) ([]gitTreeEntry, error) {
    152 	out, err := exec.Command("git", "-C", repoPath, "cat-file", "-p", obj).Output()
    153 	if err != nil {
    154 		return nil, err
    155 	}
    156 
    157 	lines := strings.Split(string(out), "\n")
    158 	lines = lines[:len(lines)-1]
    159 	result := make([]gitTreeEntry, len(lines))
    160 	for i, line := range lines {
    161 		result[i] = gitParseTreeEntry(line)
    162 	}
    163 	return result, nil
    164 }
    165 
    166 func viewUrl(repo string, path string) string {
    167 	return "/view/" + repo + "/" + path
    168 }
    169 
    170 func getFileUrl(repo string, pathFromRoot string, name string, isDir bool) string {
    171 	fileUrl := viewUrl(repo, filepath.Join(pathFromRoot, path.Clean(name)))
    172 	if isDir {
    173 		fileUrl += "/"
    174 	}
    175 	return fileUrl
    176 }
    177 
    178 func buildDirectoryListEntry(treeEntry gitTreeEntry, pathFromRoot string, repo config.RepoConfig) directoryListEntry {
    179 	var fileUrl string
    180 	var symlinkTarget string
    181 	if treeEntry.Mode == "120000" {
    182 		resolvedPath, err := gitCatBlob(treeEntry.ObjectId, repo.Path)
    183 		if err == nil {
    184 			symlinkTarget = resolvedPath
    185 		}
    186 	} else {
    187 		fileUrl = getFileUrl(repo.Name, pathFromRoot, treeEntry.ObjectName, treeEntry.ObjectType == "tree")
    188 	}
    189 	return directoryListEntry{
    190 		Name:          treeEntry.ObjectName,
    191 		Path:          fileUrl,
    192 		IsDir:         treeEntry.ObjectType == "tree",
    193 		SymlinkTarget: symlinkTarget,
    194 	}
    195 }
    196 
    197 func buildFileData(relativePath string, repo config.RepoConfig, commit string) (*fileViewerContext, error) {
    198 	commitHash := commit
    199 	out, err := gitCommitHash(commit, repo.Path)
    200 	if err == nil {
    201 		commitHash = out[:strings.Index(out, "\n")]
    202 	}
    203 	cleanPath := path.Clean(relativePath)
    204 	if cleanPath == "." {
    205 		cleanPath = ""
    206 	}
    207 	obj := commitHash + ":" + cleanPath
    208 	pathSplits := strings.Split(cleanPath, "/")
    209 
    210 	var fileContent *sourceFileContent
    211 	var dirContent *directoryContent
    212 
    213 	objectType, err := gitObjectType(obj, repo.Path)
    214 	if err != nil {
    215 		return nil, err
    216 	}
    217 	if objectType == "tree" {
    218 		treeEntries, err := gitListDir(obj, repo.Path)
    219 		if err != nil {
    220 			return nil, err
    221 		}
    222 		dirEntries := make([]directoryListEntry, len(treeEntries))
    223 		for i, treeEntry := range treeEntries {
    224 			dirEntries[i] = buildDirectoryListEntry(treeEntry, cleanPath, repo)
    225 		}
    226 		sort.Sort(DirListingSort(dirEntries))
    227 		dirContent = &directoryContent{
    228 			Entries: dirEntries,
    229 		}
    230 	} else if objectType == "blob" {
    231 		content, err := gitCatBlob(obj, repo.Path)
    232 		if err != nil {
    233 			return nil, err
    234 		}
    235 		language := filenameToLangMap[filepath.Base(cleanPath)]
    236 		if language == "" {
    237 			language = extToLangMap[filepath.Ext(cleanPath)]
    238 		}
    239 		fileContent = &sourceFileContent{
    240 			Content:   content,
    241 			LineCount: strings.Count(string(content), "\n"),
    242 			Language:  language,
    243 		}
    244 	}
    245 
    246 	segments := make([]breadCrumbEntry, len(pathSplits))
    247 	for i, name := range pathSplits {
    248 		parentPath := path.Clean(strings.Join(pathSplits[0:i], "/"))
    249 		segments[i] = breadCrumbEntry{
    250 			Name: name,
    251 			Path: getFileUrl(repo.Name, parentPath, name, true),
    252 		}
    253 	}
    254 
    255 	externalDomain := "external viewer"
    256 	if url, err := url.Parse(repo.Metadata["url-pattern"]); err == nil {
    257 		externalDomain = url.Hostname()
    258 	}
    259 
    260 	permalink := ""
    261 	headlink := ""
    262 	if !strings.HasPrefix(commitHash, commit) {
    263 		permalink = "?commit=" + commitHash[:16]
    264 	} else {
    265 		if dirContent != nil {
    266 			headlink = "."
    267 		} else {
    268 			headlink = segments[len(segments)-1].Name
    269 		}
    270 	}
    271 
    272 	return &fileViewerContext{
    273 		PathSegments:   segments,
    274 		Repo:           repo,
    275 		Commit:         commit,
    276 		DirContent:     dirContent,
    277 		FileContent:    fileContent,
    278 		ExternalDomain: externalDomain,
    279 		Permalink:      permalink,
    280 		Headlink:       headlink,
    281 	}, nil
    282 }
